subCategories.name: Centrifugal
subCategories.description: A centrifugal pump is a mechanical device designed to move a fluid by converting rotational kinetic energy into hydrodynamic energy.

subCategories.name: Vertical Centrifugal
subCategories.description: A vertical centrifugal pump is a type of centrifugal pump where the shaft is in the vertical position.

subCategories.name: Horizontal Centrifugal
subCategories.description: A horizontal centrifugal pump is a type of centrifugal pump where the shaft is in the horizontal position.

subCategories.name: Submersible
subCategories.description: A submersible pump is a device that has a hermetically sealed motor close-coupled to the pump body, designed to be submerged in the fluid to be pumped.

subCategories.name: Fire Hydrant
subCategories.description: A fire hydrant pump is a component of the fire suppression system that supplies water to the sprinkler system in case of a fire.

subCategories.name: Diaphragm
subCategories.description: A diaphragm pump is a type of positive displacement pump that uses a flexible diaphragm to pump a fluid.

subCategories.name: Gear
subCategories.description: A gear pump is a type of positive displacement pump that uses gears to pump fluid by displacement.

subCategories.name: Peristaltic
subCategories.description: A peristaltic pump is a type of positive displacement pump that uses a flexible tube to pump fluid.

subCategories.name: Lobe
subCategories.description: A lobe pump is a type of positive displacement pump that uses rotating lobes to move fluid through the pump.

subCategories.name: Piston
subCategories.description: A piston pump is a type of positive displacement pump that uses pistons to move fluid through the pump.

subCategories.name: Vacuum
subCategories.description: A vacuum pump is a device that removes gas molecules from a sealed volume to create a partial vacuum.

subCategories.name: Deep groove ball bearings
subCategories.description: Deep groove ball bearings are the most common type of rolling-element bearing. They have a deep groove raceway for high speeds and radial loads.

subCategories.name: Cylindrical roller bearings
subCategories.description: Cylindrical roller bearings are a type of rolling-element bearing that uses cylinders to maintain separation between the moving parts of the bearing.

subCategories.name: Tapered roller bearings
subCategories.description: Tapered roller bearings are a type of rolling-element bearing that can support high radial and axial loads in one direction.

subCategories.name: Thrust ball bearings
subCategories.description: Thrust ball bearings are a type of rolling-element bearing that is designed to support axial loads in one direction.

subCategories.name: Thrust roller bearings
subCategories.description: Thrust roller bearings are a type of rolling-element bearing that is designed to support axial loads in one direction.

subCategories.name: Needle roller bearings
subCategories.description: Needle roller bearings are a type of rolling-element bearing that uses long, thin cylindrical rollers to support high radial loads.

subCategories.name: Plain bearings
subCategories.description: Plain bearings are a type of bearing that relies on a sliding motion between two surfaces to support a load.

subCategories.name: Magnetic bearings
subCategories.description: Magnetic bearings are a type of bearing that uses magnetic fields to support a load without physical contact.

subCategories.name: Classic V-belt
subCategories.description: A classic V-belt is a type of drive belt that has a trapezoidal cross-section and is designed to transmit power between two shafts.

subCategories.name: Classic Banded V-belt
subCategories.description: A classic banded V-belt is a type of drive belt that has multiple V-belts joined together by a band to increase strength and stability.

subCategories.name: Wedge V-belt
subCategories.description: A wedge V-belt is a type of drive belt that has a wedge-shaped cross-section for increased power transmission.

subCategories.name: Classic Notched V-belt
subCategories.description: A classic notched V-belt is a type of drive belt that has notches on the inner side to improve flexibility and reduce heat buildup.

subCategories.name: Wedge Notched V-belt
subCategories.description: A wedge notched V-belt is a type of drive belt that has notches on the inner side and a wedge-shaped cross-section for increased power transmission.

subCategories.name: V-Rib/Multi V-belt
subCategories.description: A V-rib/multi V-belt is a type of drive belt that has multiple V-shaped ribs on one side for increased traction and power transmission.

subCategories.name: Classic Double V-belt
subCategories.description: A classic double V-belt is a type of drive belt that has two V-belts joined together to transmit power between two shafts.

subCategories.name: Globe Valve
subCategories.description: A globe valve is a type of valve used for regulating flow in a pipeline, consisting of a movable disc-type element and a stationary ring seat in a generally spherical body.

subCategories.name: Gate Valve
subCategories.description: A gate valve is a type of valve that uses a flat, wedge-shaped gate to control the flow of fluid through a pipe or duct.

subCategories.name: Control Valve
subCategories.description: A control valve is a valve used to control fluid flow by varying the size of the flow passage as directed by a signal from a controller.

subCategories.name: Flow Regulation Valve
subCategories.description: A flow regulation valve is a type of valve used to regulate or control the flow rate of a fluid.

subCategories.name: Back Pressure Valve
subCategories.description: A back pressure valve is a type of valve that is used to maintain pressure in a system.

subCategories.name: Y-Type Valve
subCategories.description: A Y-type valve is a type of valve that is shaped like the letter Y.

subCategories.name: Knife Gate Valve
subCategories.description: A knife gate valve is a type of valve designed for use in demanding environments such as slurries or powder.

subCategories.name: Check Valve
subCategories.description: A check valve is a valve that allows fluid to flow through it in only one direction.
